availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky physician. Lived in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Emeline Woodson Browning. Father of Corinne Browning Gold, Woodson Browning, Sallie Macklin Browning, Emeline W. Browning, and William M. Browning. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Masonic Order at Madisonville Lodge, No. 143.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 241-242.; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 2.; Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at the Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 128; "Dr. W. M. Browning," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=60847150&ref=acom) (accessed on March 22, 2017).
